meanings.sent1: The thirst of the traveler was quenchable with a sip of water.
meanings.sent2: After a long run, her thirst was quenchable with a cold glass of lemonade.
meanings.sent3: The quenchable fire in the fireplace crackled and popped merrily.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity was a quenchable flame, always seeking new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The quenchable desire for adventure burned brightly in her eyes.

meanings.definition: Able to be satisfied or relieved.
meanings.sent1: The hunger of the child was quenchable with a warm bowl of soup.
meanings.sent2: Her curiosity about the world was quenchable through reading books.
meanings.sent3: The quenchable excitement before the surprise party was palpable.
meanings.sent4: His quenchable ambition drove him to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The quenchable joy of a child playing in the snow is contagious.
